commit_message:
Updated log file entries for neutron

The changes adds the conntrackd logs to the rsyslog log shipping
role which will ensure that the logs are shipped to the logging server
and that the logs are rotated as expected.

Change-Id: I5e6b2cdbe2bda83cedc2a8d20d9ed3605ffc820f
Closes-Bug: 1439328

commit_message:
Be more forgiving to empty context in notification

We seem to call
rpc.get_notifier('api').error(None, 'api.fault', payload) in
notifications.py, where the first parameter is context. This
eventually calls context.to_dict() in nova/rpc.py, which breaks
for a NoneType object. So we should pick the current context
from oslo_context or switch to the admin context.

Co-Authored-By: Pranesh Pandurangan <praneshpg@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: 1360911
Change-Id: Ic37e184a56377739cd7cda5ba4bde236990fef9e

commit_message:
Set of fixes/improvements for patching tests

 * Don't fail tests if there is no GPG data in repo
   Custom repository may have no GPG signatures, so
   tests shouldn't fail if 'Release.key' not found.

 * Set highest priority to repositories on master node
   Custom repositories should be used with the same
   (or higher) priority as other repos located on
   master node.

 * Update only specified packages on Ubuntu environments
   Use 'install --only-upgrade' instead of 'upgrade' in
   order to avoid installing all available updates.

 * Remove "Enable local DNS resolving" step
   Currently we always enable local DNS resolving in
   tests during master node setup, so there is no
   need to do it again in patching tests.

Change-Id: I3fdab93ff536ed93bdc9b3c1f53cb77be6c4a73b
Implements: blueprint mos-patching-tests

[{'created': '2015-03-23 11:51:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Align default kernel params

* Add net.ifnames=0 for U14.04
* Add default biosdevname=0
* Add elevator=deadline

Deadline I/O scheduler behaves better than default CFQ
Biosdevname is used to disable Consistent Network Device Naming [1]
Additionally, for systemd net.ifnames should be disabled [2]

Related-patch: Ice24badd3ccc50c4b10230601cbf06788376c86c

[2] http://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd-udevd.service.html

commit_message:
Align default kernel params

* Add net.ifnames=0 for U14.04
* Add default biosdevname=0

Biosdevname is used to disable Consistent Network Device Naming [1]
Additionally, for systemd net.ifnames should be disabled [2]

Related-patch: Ice24badd3ccc50c4b10230601cbf06788376c86c

[1] http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Consistent_Network_Device_Naming
[2] http://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd-udevd.service.html

Related-Bug: #1430271
Change-Id: Ib993f1b238d3909428ec7fd2f012ef0e0c4eab4c

commit_message:
Horizon config changes for kilo

This change applies a few minor changes to update the local_settings.py
config file for the kilo release.

In Kilo, Horizon's exceptions and configuration around exceptions, was
refactored. This eliminates the need for us to specify which exceptions
are recoverable, not found, and unauthorized. By removing it from the
HORIZON_CONFIG variable in local_settings.py, we defer to the default
list which is rather large already without having to copy it into our
source tree.

Detailed change list:

- Updated comment for CONSOLE_TYPE setting to include the new SERIAL type
- Added the HORIZON_CONFIG['disable_password_reveal'] option
- Added the DROPDOWN_MAX_ITEMS option
- Added the ENFORCE_PASSWORD_CHECK option
- Added the AUTHENTICATION_URLS option
- Added the LAUNCH_INSTANCE options
- Added the SWIFT_FILE_TRANSFER_CHUNK_SIZE option
- Added the OPENSTACK_ENABLE_PASSWORD_RETRIEVE option
- Added the SSO options (stubbed for now)
- Updated the HORIZON_CONFIG option
- Updated the OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK option

Co-Authored By: Ian Cordasco <ian.cordasco@rackspace.com>
Partially implements blueprint: master-kilofication
Change-Id: I3cb9054447bf356444f3458935e2ba661f5e7f2c

commit_message:
Refactor direct_networks to not call Hiera directly

This function simply forms a list of networks according to our
network_scheme. We can pass $network_scheme['endpoints'] hash
as a parameter to this function instead of calling Hiera directly
from it.

Change-Id: Ic940ee20f49ed8c741f5bda452f1007a914a0707
Closes-bug: #1440028

commit_message:
Split migration test cases

To allow grouping migration test cases in classes setup_module
from pytest is used as a replacement of setupClass from unittest.
Thanks to it, migration is applied once per module.

Closes-Bug: #1441020
Change-Id: Iaf46eb988169abed3f9c65980b51a705abe299dd

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-26 18:22:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Store cells credentials in transport_url properly

Looks like we need to store the decoded version in the
database, not the encoded version...ie:
    rabbit://the=user:the=password@hostname:5672//
instead of:
    rabbit://the%3Duser:the%3Dpassword@hostname:5672//

Once we build up the transport_url and transform it into
a string, we just call unquote to convert %xx escapes back
to their single-character equivalent.

Closes-Bug: #1406598
Change-Id: I34be01de08f515c5931ff04e1eaf9815e3c2fa82

commit_message:
Store cells credentials in transport_url properly

Looks like we need to store the decoded version in the
database, not the encoded version...ie:
    rabbit://the=user:the=password@hostname:5672//
instead of:
    rabbit://the%3Duser:the%3Dpassword@hostname:5672//

Once we build up the transport_url and transform it into
a string, we just call unquote to convert %xx escapes back
to their single-character equivalent.

Closes-Bug: #1406598
Change-Id: I34be01de08f515c5931ff04e1eaf9815e3c2fa82

subject: Updating CONTRIBUTING for commit messages
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-06 15:41:41.000000000', 'files': ['CONTRIBUTING.rst'], 'message': 'Updating CONTRIBUTING for commit messages

Updated CONTRIBUTING to mention how commit messages should be written.
Presently the guidlines are missing information on how commit messages
should be written. This update simply notes that we follow upstream
openstack practices and mentions that the `GitCommitMessages` wiki
page provides all the information required to write good commit
messages.

Change-Id: I30e04da38cac4720c41418ae44da5d26c6761174
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Updating CONTRIBUTING for commit messages

Updated CONTRIBUTING to mention how commit messages should be written.
Presently the guidlines are missing information on how commit messages
should be written. This update simply notes that we follow upstream
openstack practices and mentions that the `GitCommitMessages` wiki
page provides all the information required to write good commit
messages.

Change-Id: I30e04da38cac4720c41418ae44da5d26c6761174

commit_message:
Increase deadlocks tolerance for galera

The default value for wsrep_retry_autocommit, which is 1,
does not provide good tolerance for the deadlocks.

This is a problem, if an application does not tolerate
deadlocks well and there are write-intensive loads and
1 retry could be not enough to wait for the slow
transaction to end and the lock to gone.

The solution is to increase an amount of retries what may
help to hide deadlock errors.

Related-bug: #1431702

Change-Id: Ic7dd5868522f790ef31c193165a4ec6ee80436e3
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-30 19:32:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Cancel all waiting events during compute node shutdown

Right now, if there are any threads waiting for an external event when
we start a graceful shutdown of nova-compute, we will sever our RPC inbound
connection and wait for those threads to complete. Since those threads will
not complete until they receive something over RPC, we're waiting for
something that will not come.

This patch explicitly cancels those threads by delivering "failed" events
to them, allowing them to complete their task as if the actual thing had failed.

Change-Id: I609c3a9e636ead4b41bccaceee0daa2463569148
Partial-Bug: #1438183
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-03-30 22:57:36.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Cancel all waiting events during compute node shutdown

Right now, if there are any threads waiting for an external event when
we start a graceful shutdown of nova-compute, we will sever our RPC inbound
connection and wait for those threads to complete. Since those threads will
not complete until they receive something over RPC, we're waiting for
something that will not come.

This patch explicitly cancels those threads by delivering "failed" events
to them, allowing them to complete their task as if the actual thing had failed.

Change-Id: I609c3a9e636ead4b41bccaceee0daa2463569148
Partial-Bug: #1438183
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Cancel all waiting events during compute node shutdown

Right now, if there are any threads waiting for an external event when
we start a graceful shutdown of nova-compute, we will sever our RPC inbound
connection and wait for those threads to complete. Since those threads will
not complete until they receive something over RPC, we're waiting for
something that will not come.

This patch explicitly cancels those threads by delivering "failed" events
to them, allowing them to complete their task as if the actual thing had failed.

Change-Id: I609c3a9e636ead4b41bccaceee0daa2463569148
Partial-Bug: #1438183

commit_message:
Clean-up python-pcs

In order to avoid conflicts with Packet Construction Set which is by
default in Ubuntu mirrors, package was renamed to pcs

It should be merged after https://review.openstack.org/#/c/164109/

Note: python-pcs should be also removed manually from build repository
as it was placed there manually just not to break CI


Change-Id: Ib6a8349df3b52c80ce59daf43727db819d808087
Implements: support-ubuntu-trusty
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Reorganize unit test tree

This change ensures that the structure of the unit test tree matches
that of the code tree to make it obvious where to find tests for a
given module.  A check is added to the pep8 job to protect against
regressions.

The plugin test paths are relocated to neutron/tests/unit/plugins
but are otherwise ignored for now.

Change-Id: If307593259139171be21a71c58e3a34bf148cc7f
Partial-Bug: #1440834

commit_message:
User Guides: Display changed date, version

Instead of "Updated: None" show date of last build.

Set version/release to 1.0.0 in preparation for the release.

Change-Id: Id379bfb91f3c229185626fa5ee44b87471fe7aaa

commit_message:
Fixed encrypted property for 3PAR FC and iSCSI drivers

3PAR FC and iSCSI drivers were not returning the 'encrypted'
property when initialize_connection was called. This patch
adds that property to the returned info.

Closes-Bug: #1439917
Change-Id: Icfbebd055ea1bae1fc4749b441eb4f90fa1bfacd

commit_message:
Reorganize plugin test modules

This change moves plugin test modules to conform to the new rules on
unit test tree structure (see TESTING.rst).

Vendor plugin paths continue to be ignored, and unit test modules that
test features instead of modules are also ignored pending their
removal to the functional test tree.

Change-Id: I482c377ca72ffd58692ad84bd9692356513e4c98
Closes-Bug: #1440834

commit_message:
Fix stack update issue

Different type of resource with same name should consider to be a
new resource when stack-update.

Change-Id: I102ffbd1a1562c164f43969c87570096c280738a
Closes-Bug: #1404201

commit_message:
Merge open source plugin test code modules

The unit test reorg is about moving files around so a test module is
clearly associated with the code module it targets, but the test
modules in this change needed to be manually merged because they both
targeted the same module.

Change-Id: I80f4b97fadd318896e7fa4e7e7e939f924127b2a
Partial-Bug: #1440834

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-27 03:37:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'More error handling on migration failure.

If a LUN migration session is stopped or faulted after started,
current implementation of VNX Cinder Driver only wait for timeout
and no logic will clean up the broken migration session.

This patch adds logic to detect and clean up the stopped/faulted
migration session.

commit_message:
More error handling on EMC VNX migration failure

If a LUN migration session is stopped or faulted after started,
current implementation of VNX Cinder Driver only wait for timeout
and no logic will clean up the broken migration session.

This patch adds logic to detect and clean up the stopped/faulted
migration session.

Change-Id: If66109ca45fce303390c4144b4120e75f1aae138
Closes-Bug: #1420075

commit_message:
Adding VLAN Transparency support to neutronclient

Adding VLAN Transparency support to neutronclient, it allows
to create new vlan transparent networks. It adds support for
displaying the network vlan transparency support via net-list.

DocImpact
Depends-on: Ie87087a70b83dab589419aa5c17ce7ccafd64cbd
Implements: blueprint nfv-vlan-trunks

Change-Id: I24c2eecd34123933f98b596654baaf76ed1453e8

commit_message:
Implement validators and tests for stored key certificate orders

Adding validators for the stored key method of the Certificate
Order API.  Validate the container ref is valid and the
container exists and is of the right type.  Some test
infrastructure code will be useful for other work.

Change-Id: I93ad6b630424795be9d3d4d2b599a7100c4568f9
Implements: blueprint certificate-order-api

commit_message:
Add totalSecurityGroupRulesUsed to used_limits api

This patch adds totalSecurityGroupRulesUsed mapping to
security_group_rules.
user will get totalSecurityGroupRulesUsed by calling
nova absolute-limits in python-novaclient

Closes-Bug: 1246761
Change-Id: If81716fbd1e131ce94da8f16d5a17c2f25d3f776

commit_message:
Add tox functional target

Create a formal tox target for functional tests.
Also we should not be overriding the user's localrc.

Closes-Bug: #1440125
Change-Id: Ide639ea89050cf3e1f1e9e40c687d506998f7587

subject: Raise more generic exception in bay_update API.
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-06 07:24:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Raise more generic exception in bay_update API.

We can't update bay when the status is not CREATE_COMPLETE or
UPDATE_COMPLETE. If we try to update a bay with status
CREATE_FAILED, it failed with 500 status.
This patch returns 400 status to user when they try to update any
bay in invalid state.

commit_message:
Raise more generic exception in bay_update API.

We can't update bay when the status is not CREATE_COMPLETE or
UPDATE_COMPLETE. If we try to update a bay with status
CREATE_FAILED, it failed with 500 status.
This patch returns 400 status to user when they try to update any
bay in invalid state.

Change-Id: Ia7c786a97eba7518d98a61ae959205f34c876cfa
Closes-bug: #1440644

commit_message:
Small ec diskfile refactor

Right now, ec diskfile might make an invalid filename (e.g. '.data'
without fragment index on EC) because the diskfile allows to set
empty fragment index against '.data' file on EC.

i.e. 'ts.data' will be created for EC policy and then the diskfile
will assume the file without the fragment index as an obsolete_file
on read. To prevent to make such a file unfortunately, this refactor
add a validation method into ts_to_fname.

This add also small fixes related on EC code.

Change-Id: Ibd66ad06b7db10421e0832e93d82deb839ba972b

Avoid unnecessary restart of replication master

in a replication set when a new slave is added to a
previously existing master site.

commit_message:
Make integration-tests run quicker

Attempt to make the integration tests run faster in the following ways:

1. Remove the duplication of restore tests: We test restore of both an
   incremental and a non-incremental backup, which really tests the same
   code path twice. Testing a restore of an incremental backup should be
   sufficient since it's a superset of the non-incremental case. In
   simpler words, there is no case when restore from a full backup will
   fail and restore from an incremental backup will succeed, so it is
   sufficient to test the latter scenario only.

2. Spend less time idly waiting for instances to go ACTIVE. The idea is
   to be able to run other tests during the waiting periods, so that we
   can parallelize tests and reduce the overall time taken to run the
   suite.

Closes-bug: 1394972

Change-Id: Ia9f9c4198f2dcafdacefe46bc48ad20d4714a70e

subject: Fix bug in action theory on restart
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-02 19:40:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix bug in action theory on restart

The bug was that creating a theory of kind 'action' produced
an in-memory 'action' policy but stored the type of that policy
as 'nonrecursive' in the database.  So on restart, the policy
engine would create a policy of the wrong kind, which would
in turn cause some rules stored in the DB to be incorrectly
rejected, thereby causing a fatal error.

The fix was to change the code that looked up the type of
a theory from checking isinstance() to looking at the
field of the theory that is set to the name of the policy
type.

Closes-bug: 1439536
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-04-02 20:08:49.000000000', 'files': ['congress/tests/test_congress.py', 'congress/policy_engines/agnostic.py'], 'message': "Fix bug in action theory on restart

as 'nonrecursive' in the database.  So on restart, the policy
engine would create a policy of the wrong kind, which would
in turn cause some rules stored in the DB to be incorrectly
rejected, thereby causing a fatal error.

The fix was to change the code that looked up the type of
a theory from checking isinstance() to looking at the
field of the theory that is set to the name of the policy
type.

Change-Id: I869fa835d07a863e8d5473a638db52e3ed4d6133
Closes-bug: 1439536

commit_message:
Fix bug in action theory on restart

The bug was that creating a theory of kind 'action' produced
an in-memory 'action' policy but stored the type of that policy
as 'nonrecursive' in the database.  So on restart, the policy
engine would create a policy of the wrong kind, which would
in turn cause some rules stored in the DB to be incorrectly
rejected, thereby causing a fatal error.

The fix was to change the code that looked up the type of
a theory from checking isinstance() to looking at the
field of the theory that is set to the name of the policy
type.

Change-Id: I869fa835d07a863e8d5473a638db52e3ed4d6133
Closes-bug: 1439536

commit_message:
neutronv2: only create client once when adding/removing fixed IPs

We don't need to create a neutron client object (session) every time we
need to make an API call in add_fixed_ip_to_instance or
remove_fixed_ip_from_instance, especially when looping over ports and
subnets.

Just create the client once at the beginning of the method and reuse it.

Closes-Bug: #1430481

Change-Id: If9181c2ef5fb94652d0205d6d69521bcc5d85cff

[{'created': '2015-03-27 23:21:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: remove volume_drivers config param

Copied commit message from
commit I1f884f36e24fe478922671ca3eaf6b7c21fd8a5a

The 'volumes_drivers' parameter does the same job as the
'vif_driver' parameter, but for volumes instead of vifs.

The API for the LibvirtBaseVolumeDriver class is not
considered to be a public extension point. As such it
is not required or expected to remain compatible across
releases.

The main reason for its existance is for people who are
developing new cinder drivers, to be able to write out
of tree nova volume drivers. The recommended practice
is to instead work in-tree to nova on a branch. This is
an approach that would be required in order to submit
the work for review and eventual merge in any case.

commit I1f884f36e24fe478922671ca3eaf6b7c21fd8a5a
deprecated it and during the discussion the actually target
is Kilo. But it's K-3 so more reasonable target is
Liberty.

Closes-Bug: #1371175

Change-Id: I832820499ec3304132379ad9b9d1ee92c5a75b61
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
libvirt: remove volume_drivers config param

Copied commit message from
commit I1f884f36e24fe478922671ca3eaf6b7c21fd8a5a

The 'volumes_drivers' parameter does the same job as the
'vif_driver' parameter, but for volumes instead of vifs.

The API for the LibvirtBaseVolumeDriver class is not
considered to be a public extension point. As such it
is not required or expected to remain compatible across
releases.

The main reason for its existance is for people who are
developing new cinder drivers, to be able to write out
of tree nova volume drivers. The recommended practice
is to instead work in-tree to nova on a branch. This is
an approach that would be required in order to submit
the work for review and eventual merge in any case.

commit I1f884f36e24fe478922671ca3eaf6b7c21fd8a5a
deprecated it and during the discussion the actually target
is Kilo. But it's K-3 so more reasonable target is
Liberty.

DocImpact: libvirt.volume_drivers config param is removed.

Closes-Bug: #1371175

Change-Id: I832820499ec3304132379ad9b9d1ee92c5a75b61

commit_message:
Skip example retargetable functional test

The example retargetable test that previously ran as part of the
functional suite is now skipped due to the fullstack example's db
fixture usage causing the test to fail if it the fullstack example
runs first on the same worker.

Change-Id: I0a34f9ba04c53a4291698be819070c66009c8b4a
Related-Bug: #1440797

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-17 15:44:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow metadata proxy running with nobody user/group

Currently metadata proxy cannot run with nobody user/group as metadata
proxy requires to connect to metadata_proxy_socket when queried.

This change allows to run metadata proxy with nobody. use/group by
allowing to choose the metadata_proxy_socket mode with the new option
metadata_proxy_socket_mode in order to adapt socket permissions to
metadata proxy user/group.

DocImpact
 * metadata_proxy_user unset implies no constraints
   With this configuration, metadata proxy has the same permissions as
   dhpc/l3 agents and is able to use rootwrap.
 * metadata_proxy_user=nobody/65534 implies the constraints:
   * metadata_proxy_log_mode != legacy
   * metadata_proxy_socket_mode >= 0o664
   With this configuration, metadata proxy is no more able to use
   rootwrap.
 * metadata_proxy_user=nobody/65534 and
   metadata_proxy_group=nobody/65534 imply the constraints:
   * metadata_proxy_log_mode != legacy
   * metadata_proxy_socket_mode == 0o666
   With this configuration, metadata proxy has the lowest permissions
   but metadata proxy socket can be opened by everyone.

Change-Id: I235a0cc4f0cbd55ae4ec1570daf2ebbb6a72441d
Closes-Bug: #1427228

Currently metadata proxy cannot run with nobody user/group as metadata
proxy requires to connect to metadata_proxy_socket when queried.

This change allows to run metadata proxy with nobody. use/group by
allowing to choose the metadata_proxy_socket mode with the new option
metadata_proxy_socket_mode in order to adapt socket permissions to
metadata proxy user/group.

DocImpact
 * metadata_proxy_user unset implies no constraints
   With this configuration, metadata proxy has the same permissions as

 * metadata_proxy_user=nobody/65534 implies the constraints:
   * metadata_proxy_log_mode != legacy
   * metadata_proxy_socket_mode >= 0o664
   With this configuration, metadata proxy is no more able to use
   rootwrap.
 * metadata_proxy_user=nobody/65534 and
   metadata_proxy_group=nobody/65534 imply the constraints:
   * metadata_proxy_log_mode != legacy
   * metadata_proxy_socket_mode == 0o666
   With this configuration, metadata proxy has the lowest permissions
   but metadata proxy socket can be opened by everyone.

Change-Id: I235a0cc4f0cbd55ae4ec1570daf2ebbb6a72441d
Closes-Bug: #1427228
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-03-20 19:39:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow metadata proxy running with nobody user/group

Currently metadata proxy cannot run with nobody user/group as metadata
proxy requires to connect to metadata_proxy_socket when queried.

This change allows to run metadata proxy with nobody user/group by
allowing to choose the metadata_proxy_socket mode with the new option
metadata_proxy_socket_mode (3 choices) in order to adapt socket
permissions to metadata proxy user/group.

In practice:
* if metadata_proxy_user is agent effective user or root, then:
  * metadata proxy is allowed to use rootwrap (unsecure)
  * set metadata_proxy_socket_mode = user (default, 0o644)
* else if metadata_proxy_group is agent effective group, then:
  * metadata proxy is not allowed to use rootwrap (secure)
  * set metadata_proxy_socket_mode = group (0o664)
  * set metadata_proxy_log_watch = false
* else:
  * metadata proxy has lowest permissions (securest) but metadata proxy
    socket can be opened by everyone
  * set metadata_proxy_socket_mode = all (0o666)
  * set metadata_proxy_log_watch = false

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1427228
Change-Id: I235a0cc4f0cbd55ae4ec1570daf2ebbb6a72441d

', 'number': 7}, {'created': '2015-04-01 06:42:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow metadata proxy running with nobody user/group

Currently metadata proxy cannot run with nobody user/group as metadata
proxy requires to connect to metadata_proxy_socket when queried.

This change allows to run metadata proxy with nobody user/group by
allowing to choose the metadata_proxy_socket mode with the new option
metadata_proxy_socket_mode (4 choices) in order to adapt socket
permissions to metadata proxy user/group.

In practice:
* if metadata_proxy_user is agent effective user or root, then:
  * metadata proxy is allowed to use rootwrap (unsecure)
  * set metadata_proxy_socket_mode = user (0o644)
* else if metadata_proxy_group is agent effective group, then:
  * metadata proxy is not allowed to use rootwrap (secure)
  * set metadata_proxy_socket_mode = group (0o664)
  * set metadata_proxy_log_watch = false
* else:
  * metadata proxy has lowest permissions (securest) but metadata proxy
    socket can be opened by everyone
  * set metadata_proxy_socket_mode = all (0o666)
  * set metadata_proxy_log_watch = false

An alternative is to set metadata_proxy_socket_mode = deduce, in such
case metadata agent uses previous rules to choose the correct mode.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1427228
Change-Id: I235a0cc4f0cbd55ae4ec1570daf2ebbb6a72441d

This change allows to run metadata proxy with nobody user/group by
allowing to choose the metadata_proxy_socket mode with the new option
metadata_proxy_socket_mode (4 choices) in order to adapt socket
permissions to metadata proxy user/group.

In practice:
* if metadata_proxy_user is agent effective user or root, then:
  * metadata proxy is allowed to use rootwrap (unsecure)
  * set metadata_proxy_socket_mode = user (0o644)
* else if metadata_proxy_group is agent effective group, then:
  * metadata proxy is not allowed to use rootwrap (secure)
  * set metadata_proxy_socket_mode = group (0o664)
  * set metadata_proxy_log_watch = false
* else:
  * metadata proxy has lowest permissions (securest) but metadata proxy
    socket can be opened by everyone
  * set metadata_proxy_socket_mode = all (0o666)
  * set metadata_proxy_log_watch = false

An alternative is to set metadata_proxy_socket_mode = deduce, in such
case metadata agent uses previous rules to choose the correct mode.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1427228

commit_message:
Allow metadata proxy running with nobody user/group

Currently metadata proxy cannot run with nobody user/group as metadata
proxy requires to connect to metadata_proxy_socket when queried.

This change allows to run metadata proxy with nobody user/group by
allowing to choose the metadata_proxy_socket mode with the new option
metadata_proxy_socket_mode (4 choices) in order to adapt socket
permissions to metadata proxy user/group.

This change refactors also where options are defined to enable
metadata_proxy_user/group options in the metadata agent.

In practice:
* if metadata_proxy_user is agent effective user or root, then:
  * metadata proxy is allowed to use rootwrap (unsecure)
  * set metadata_proxy_socket_mode = user (0o644)
* else if metadata_proxy_group is agent effective group, then:
  * metadata proxy is not allowed to use rootwrap (secure)
  * set metadata_proxy_socket_mode = group (0o664)
  * set metadata_proxy_log_watch = false
* else:
  * metadata proxy has lowest permissions (securest) but metadata proxy
    socket can be opened by everyone
  * set metadata_proxy_socket_mode = all (0o666)
  * set metadata_proxy_log_watch = false

An alternative is to set metadata_proxy_socket_mode = deduce, in such
case metadata agent uses previous rules to choose the correct mode.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1427228
Change-Id: I235a0cc4f0cbd55ae4ec1570daf2ebbb6a72441d

commit_message:
Adding policy layer changes for ACL support (Part 5)

Added ACL based policy support for a secret or container
'read' operation.
Added support for allowing secret and container's creator
to perform 'get' call.
Added unit tests for policy changes.

Changed logic around secret or container project to match
client token's project. Now it uses policy rule instead
of using it in db lookup critieria.

Depends-On: I62668c03d48a3fa7477f7de8f7240b38b7e22eab

Change-Id: Ie28ed00125676fed5359cbb3e28a11648cf43a82
Implements: blueprint add-per-secret-policy

subject: Fix TypeError caused by err_msg formatting
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-06 14:30:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix TypeError caused by err_msg formatting

Remove 'retry' param from a rabbitmq error message in
a recoverable_errors block. The retry variable can
be None which causes this exception to be formatted
incorrectly.

Change-Id: I592ea3e44506afb4a676d8dbe1e659a0e649424e
Closes-bug: #1440755
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-04-06 17:13:09.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': 'Fix TypeError caused by err_msg formatting

The retry variable can be None which causes this exception to be
formatted incorrectly. Switching from %(retry)d to %(retry)s

commit_message:
Fix TypeError caused by err_msg formatting

The retry variable can be None which causes this exception to be
formatted incorrectly. Switching from %(retry)d to %(retry)s
should handle the case where retry is None more gracefully.

Change-Id: I592ea3e44506afb4a676d8dbe1e659a0e649424e
Closes-bug: #1440755

commit_message:
Making multiple fixes to the cue dashboard

- Renaming column names

- Add flavor details to create cluster
- Update tooltips

commit_message:
Refactor test code to reduce duplication

As part of review 163730 a helper method was identified as being
duplicated.  This patch moves the code to a common location, and
updates the users of it to use the new version.  There's no
functionality change in this patch, just a refactoring.

Change-Id: I4a49099c6b8ff3b7078d57a49212f6663d03d698

commit_message:
Adding Container ACL controller layer changes (Part 4)

Added GET/POST/PATCH/DELETE support for ContainerACL operations.
Added unit tests for container acls controller.

Depends-On: Ic23d7823d76a4fec015459e39b531e46ea29df79

Change-Id: I62668c03d48a3fa7477f7de8f7240b38b7e22eab
Implements: blueprint add-per-secret-policy

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-01 07:12:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Disable XML now that we have WSME/Pecan support

We've had a desire to disable XML from the Ironic API for some
time, however to do so needed support in WSME/Pecan.  That's now
been added, so we can implement the Ironic side.

To do so, without modifying every single wsexpose decorator in
Ironic (i.e. every single endpoint) we monkey patch wsexpose,
adding in the specification of the 'rest_content_types' that we
wish to support and then invoke the original wsexpose decorator.

Change-Id: I94d0387722225c4356c867f63b6f1a61356f317d
Closes-bug: 1251880

We've had a desire to disable XML from the Ironic API for some
time, however to do so needed support in WSME/Pecan.  That's now

commit_message:
Disable XML now that we have WSME/Pecan support

We've had a desire to disable XML from the Ironic API for some
time, however to do so needed support in WSME/Pecan.  That's now
been added, so we can implement the Ironic side.

To do so, we wrap wsmeext.pecan.expose() and replace all the decorators
with a call to ironic.api.expose.expose().

Change-Id: I94d0387722225c4356c867f63b6f1a61356f317d
Closes-bug: 1271317

commit_message:
Fix logic in modal to accept cancel param

Fixes logic so that cancel parameter overrides the default.  Removed
defaults for title and body when they are in fact required by logic.

Change-Id: Ic964949ee3ab8558684780207bcd4404b01e4d67
Closes-Bug: 1439794

commit_message:
Add NPM Command Execution as a Build Target

- Add npm-run as a build macro.
- Add xvfb-start as a build macro for generic xvfb startup.
- Added gate-{project}-npm-run-{command} as a build template.
- Made that same build template non-voting.
- Added gate-storyboard-webclient-npm-run-lint as a first job.

Note that using this target presumes that you will pipe your output reports
into ./reports.

Change-Id: Ie772bf2c7b56aaed3c36fc1cb1cb970dfc3f93ff

commit_message:
Remove hyphen from rand_name calls in scenario tests

data_utils.rand_name() appends randam charactors with a hypen like:

 def rand_name(name=''):
     randbits = str(random.randint(1, 0x7fffffff))
     if name:
         return name + '-' + randbits

So it is not necessary to specify a hypen in caller side.
This patch removes a hypen in scenario tests.

Change-Id: I21f19e27c3081ac35317d9422436bd8062eced2d

commit_message:
Error doc builds on WARN or ERROR

This will ensure that any new commits to IPA won't pass a docs job if
they introduce improperly formatted doc strings. This will enable us to
ensure our generated documentation remains of a high quality.

I will be following this up with a change to project-config to have IPA
run the docs job on every change.

Change-Id: I90236225623298a7070db1ff22acb44dddb1c520

subject: Limit tempest.config's use of cfg.CONF
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-31 15:54:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Stop using cfg.CONF directly

Using the oslo_config.cfg.CONF global object directly has the
potential to conflict with the lazy-loading of the tempest.config.CONF
instance.  Rather than requiring selective enforcement of this rule -
allowed in unit tests and not everywhere else - this change removes
all use of cfg.CONF outside of tempest.config.

This change also supports the resuse of tempest's config machinery by
other projects such as Neutron.  Use of cfg.CONF can be replaced with
a local ConfigOpts instance by changing a single line (preventing
conflict with the consuming project's config), which can be easily
maintained by a copy script.

Change-Id: Ia2cdd54af8c06d3a38a62183c1f03cd317c3972d
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-03-31 16:22:20.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/config.py'], 'message': "Limit tempest.config's use of cfg.CONF

This change supports the resuse of tempest's config machinery by other
projects such as Neutron.  Use of cfg.CONF can be replaced with a
local ConfigOpts instance by changing a single line (preventing
conflict with the consuming project's config), which can be easily
maintained by a copy script.  This ensures that a project that uses
the cfg.CONF global won't run into conflicts with tempest's
configuration.

Change-Id: Ia2cdd54af8c06d3a38a62183c1f03cd317c3972d
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Limit tempest.config's use of cfg.CONF

This change supports the resuse of tempest's config machinery by other
projects such as Neutron.  Use of cfg.CONF can be replaced with a
local ConfigOpts instance by changing a single line (preventing
conflict with the consuming project's config), which can be easily
maintained by a copy script.  This ensures that a project that uses
the cfg.CONF global won't run into conflicts with tempest's
configuration.

Change-Id: Ia2cdd54af8c06d3a38a62183c1f03cd317c3972d

subject: L3 Agent Scheduler testcase cleanups
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-01 19:39:05.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/admin/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py'], 'message': 'L3 Agent Scheduler testcase cleanups

This patch cleans up the test case a bit: it uses the base class
method to create/delete routers, and ensure that, when selecting
the L3 agent, this is of a specific type, i.e. legacy. In multi
node environments, and especially the ones post-Juno, there may
be more than one L3 agent running and having the ability to filter
based on the type is instrumental to getting this test case to
work while validating multi-node deployments.

Change-Id: I479b8f52e6da0f520bda965580beddbae0c6a296
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
L3 Agent Scheduler testcase cleanups

This patch cleans up the test case a bit: it uses the base class
method to create/delete routers, and ensure that, when selecting
the L3 agent, this is of a specific type, i.e. legacy. In multi
node environments, and especially the ones post-Juno, there may
be more than one L3 agent running and having the ability to filter
based on the type is instrumental to getting this test case to
work while validating multi-node deployments.

Change-Id: I479b8f52e6da0f520bda965580beddbae0c6a296

subject: Pmanager: Add udev settle after trigger
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14774, 'name': 'Fuel TPI CI', 'email': 'pi-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-tpi-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-03 18:25:09.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/cobbler/templates/scripts/pmanager.py'], 'message': "Pmanager: Add udev settle after trigger

Since udev is well known for its async nature, we need to be sure
that it finishes its queue processing after calling 'udevadm trigger'.
'udevadm settle' is the only way to achive that sync.

Otherwise, we could end up with unexpectable changes in devfs in the
middle of the rest of the script execution.

Change-Id: Ie994b5fbb070314621ba369e7a4f4850cf400173
Related-Bug: #1410471
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Pmanager: Add udev settle after trigger

Since udev is well known for its async nature, we need to be sure
that it finishes its queue processing after calling 'udevadm trigger'.
'udevadm settle' is the only way to achive that sync.

Otherwise, we could end up with unexpectable changes in devfs in the
middle of the rest of the script execution.

Change-Id: Ie994b5fbb070314621ba369e7a4f4850cf400173
Related-Bug: #1410471

commit_message:
Fix floating problem with OSD down

* Add the OSD activation and check if osd process for each OSD is started.
* Change the process of adding OSDs to cluster. Now Ceph OSDs are added one by
 one instead of by all together. This allows to check the every OSD status
 during adding to cluster.

Change-Id: I8e64c1b15ed92e6fb5939b6f41728efacae64319
Closes-bug: #1419884

commit_message:
Don't add unformatted project-specific endpoints to catalog

If a token is domain-scoped, there is no project defined.
Hence for any catalog entries, we should skip any endpoints
that need a project id in order to be formatted correctly.

Co-Authored-By: Henry Nash <henryn@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I3617a2509bfc4213f136b5c867c40d478a70ded8
Closes-Bug: #1261468

In current version of nova, live-migration with config drive on
local disk is forbidden due to the bug of libvirt of copying readonly
disk. However, if we use vfat as the format of config drive,
the function of live-migration works well.

In this patch, we re-open the function of live-migration to admin users.
Notice you should add 'config_drive_format=vfat' in nova.conf explicitly.

This patch doesn't solve the problem fundamentally which need further
efforts, but offers a simple and feasible workaround to user.

Conflicts:

NOTE(mriedem): The conflicts are due to:

1. The tests being moved in Kilo.
2. Not having commit 152fb73a3 in stable/juno, this is why we
   remove the volume entry from the expected return data.
3. Not having commit 96195d51f in stalbe/juno, this is why we
   aren't using objects in the test and have to explicitly
   set name and kernel_id on self.test_instance.

Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <davanum@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I7429e12766da7f7f8d484b3a9df6247e832816b0
Partial-Bug: #1246201
(cherry picked from commit 4e665112f275f17a90c6f96daa805af652c66fa0)

commit_message:
libvirt: partial fix for live-migration with config drive

In current version of nova, live-migration with config drive on
local disk is forbidden due to the bug of libvirt of copying readonly
disk. However, if we use vfat as the format of config drive,
the function of live-migration works well.

In this patch, we re-open the function of live-migration to admin users.
Notice you should add 'config_drive_format=vfat' in nova.conf explicitly.

This patch doesn't solve the problem fundamentally which need further
efforts, but offers a simple and feasible workaround to user.

DocImpact

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflicts are due to:

1. The tests being moved in Kilo.
2. Not having commit 152fb73a3 in stable/juno, this is why we
   remove the volume entry from the expected return data.
3. Not having commit 96195d51f in stalbe/juno, this is why we
   aren't using objects in the test and have to explicitly
   set name and kernel_id on self.test_instance.

Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <davanum@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I7429e12766da7f7f8d484b3a9df6247e832816b0
Partial-Bug: #1246201
(cherry picked from commit 4e665112f275f17a90c6f96daa805af652c66fa0)

commit_message:
Remove ordereddict from requirements.txt

The ordereddict package is now part of Python 2.7 and
since Python 2.6 is no longer supported (as of Kilo) we
can remove this package from trove/requirements.txt

Change-Id: I5ee8b047606ef65dd99e68a496d7184ae329fb7f
Closes-bug: 1440738

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Move testresources/testscenarios into test-requirements

Commit 6ccea346d9609d47b188b33c686f49ce3f4f9b14 moved testscenarios out
of test-requirements and into requirements.txt (and added testresources)
because the oslo_db.sqlalchemy.provision module now imports
testresources.  However, provision is only used (imported from) test
code, so the testresources and testscenarioes requirements should still
live in test-requirements.

This is particularly important for distro packagers that don't really
want to package and ship testresources/scenarios for test code that they
may or may not be packaging.

Closes-Bug: #1429233

Change-Id: If71102dfe984d7a2873367bfd00c2b923727a91f

commit_message:
Fixes the port_delete call of inexistent port issue

The Hyper-V Neutron Agent processes the ports periodically.
If a port has been removed (instance was removed), then the
port will be unbound.
If an RPC call is received for the method "port_delete" for
a port that was not processed yet or the port was already
unbound, a 'TypeError' exception occurs.

The method _get_network_vswitch_map_by_port_id now
returns (None, None), if the port was not found and the
exception is avoided.

Closes-Bug: #1438711

Change-Id: I4f8b66e5af6b0b033e51549989f78f86d14840be

commit_message:
Destroy the related resources when delete a bay

Currently, when we delete a bay, we will delete the stack firstly,
then try to detroy the bay record in db. And at this time, a
BayNotEmpty exception may raised if some of pods, services or rc
are related to this bay. In the meanwhile, the stack should be already
deleted, actually, the left bay record is unavailable.

This patch destroy the related resources when delete a bay.

Change-Id: I56cd8813417bd4a6f6c340deb8afd88d5516f225
Closes-bug: #1440630

commit_message:
Pass instance object to add_instance_fault_from_exc

The add_instance_fault_from_exc method was recently changed to require
that it is passed an instance object.  When a scheduled build failed in
conductor the utility method it was using to set the instance to error
and report the fault was passing a db model to
add_instance_fault_from_exc.  This updates that method to properly pass
an instance object.

Change-Id: I3f0d0f5069c6b61a1450a626d92864076384c34d
Closes-Bug: 1438315

commit_message:
Fix copy configdrive during live-migration on HyperV

This bug was introduced due to an oversight when fixing
https://launchpad.net/bugs/1322096 . In that fix, we use the
"config_drive_cdrom" value from the conf to determine if a
there is a iso configdrive attached to the instance. This
approach is wrong due to the fact that that config value can be
modified by the user. If that happens, instances that still have
iso configdrives will be ommitted.

This path fixes this problem by checking the instance itself if
it has any iso attached to it.

Closes-Bug: #1427467
Change-Id: Ia64389b4405109d7db6fbf9c000a0136e9862298

', 'number': 5}, {'created': '2015-04-03 17:35:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix field 'deleted' in DB migrations for compatibility with PostgreSQL

Our migrations set field 'deleted' as Boolean for table
'share_type_extra_specs', but model 'ShareTypeExtraSpecs' treats it as Integer.
It works using MySQL as far it uses 'tinyint' storing `1` or `0` there. So, in
case of MySQL it is always Integer.
But PostgreSQL fails to write any records there because it distinguishes
Boolean from Integer. So, fix migrations to make mentioned field an Integer.

Change-Id: I0ca00ce86adad893ac786b10324a934d372e2a04
Closes-Bug: #1440089
", 'number': 6}, {'created': '2015-04-03 18:52:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix fields 'deleted' in various DB models for PostgreSQL compatibility

Our migrations set field 'deleted' as Boolean for table
'share_type_extra_specs', but model 'ShareTypeExtraSpecs' treats it as Integer.
Same for several other models.
It works using MySQL as far it uses 'tinyint' storing `1` or `0` there. So, in
case of MySQL it is always Integer.
But PostgreSQL fails to write any records there because it distinguishes
Boolean from Integer. So, fix DB migrations, DB methods and models to make
mentioned field compatible for PostreSQL backend too.

Change-Id: I0ca00ce86adad893ac786b10324a934d372e2a04
Closes-Bug: #1440089

commit_message:
Fix fields 'deleted' in various DB models for PostgreSQL compatibility

Our migrations set field 'deleted' as Boolean for table
'share_type_extra_specs', but model 'ShareTypeExtraSpecs' treats it as Integer.
Same for several other models.
It works using MySQL as far it uses 'tinyint' storing `1` or `0` there. So, in
case of MySQL it is always Integer.
But PostgreSQL fails to write any records there because it distinguishes
Boolean from Integer. So, fix DB migrations, DB methods and models to make
mentioned field compatible for PostreSQL backend too.

Also, reuse func 'model_query' from oslo_db to remove errors with queries that
contain aggregate functions.

Change-Id: I0ca00ce86adad893ac786b10324a934d372e2a04
Closes-Bug: #1440089

commit_message:
Add tempest coverage for share type access operations

Manila allows to make share type as private and set access to some projects
by its ID. This functionality is not covered at all by tempest tests.

Change-Id: I8ab83da87372b97b55dae5de6e649fbf44e068e3
Closes-Bug: #1440169

commit_message:
Restore worker tasks processing catching exceptions

Worker RPC task processing is once again catching exceptions so as to
prevent rolling back database transactions, which would also rollback
attempts to set the order's status to ERROR. I will add an item to the
Liberty discussion etherpad to revisit our rollback policy on worker/
asynchronous processing.

Change-Id: Ia9f4519937da32e5d7cf21fb3b8b6f3b5285274f

[{'created': '2015-03-20 23:44:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Logging not using oslo.i18n guidelines

Multi-patch set for easier chunks. This one addresses
the backup and common cinder directories.

There have been quite a few instances found where the
i18n guidelines are not being followed. I believe this
has helped lead to some of the confusion around how to
correctly do this. Other developers see this code and
assume it is an example of the correct usage.

This patch attempts to clean up most of those violations
in the existing codebase to hopefully help avoid some of
that confusion in reviews.

Some issues address:
* Correct log translation markers for different log levels
* Passing format values as arguments to call, not preformatting
* Not forcing translation via six.text_type and others

Guidelines can be found here:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Hacking checks will not be able to identify all violations of
the guidelines, but it could be useful for catching obvious ones
such as LOG.info("No markers!").

Change-Id: I2560d9dee564f5a9b214fd63ccd2600d78a30464
Partial-bug: 1433216

commit_message:
Logging not using oslo.i18n guidelines

Multi-patch set for easier chunks. This one addresses
the backup and common cinder directories.

There have been quite a few instances found where the
i18n guidelines are not being followed. I believe this
has helped lead to some of the confusion around how to
correctly do this. Other developers see this code and
assume it is an example of the correct usage.

This patch attempts to clean up most of those violations
in the existing codebase to hopefully help avoid some of
that confusion in reviews.

Some issues address:
* Correct log translation markers for different log levels
* Passing format values as arguments to call, not preformatting
* Not forcing translation via six.text_type and others

Guidelines can be found here:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Hacking checks will not be able to identify all violations of
the guidelines, but it could be useful for catching obvious ones
such as LOG.info("No markers!").

Change-Id: I2560d9dee564f5a9b214fd63ccd2600d78a30464
Partial-bug: 1433216

Change-Id: I3da0fa52c6e8937c0893464887d9f7e014123224", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-03-17 18:24:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Support the equivalent of the Juno API

Shortly after Kilo development was opened, the new MaintenanceController
class and REST endpoint, along with the 'maintenance_reason' property
were added. This was done before microversion support was added to the
Kilo API.

When we later added microversion support, the initial (and minimum
supported) version was declared to be v1.1, with the intent that v1.0
would be equivalent to Juno. However the work was not done at that time
to actually implement it as such, and for the intervening time, Ironic's
REST API has defaulted to v1.1

This patch goes back and adds a guard around the maintenance API
changes, such that it is possible for the API service to provide
the same API semantics that Juno supported.

It lowers the API MIN_VERSION from 1.1 to 1.0, thus changing the default
behavior of Ironic's REST API (in the absence of any version header)
to be the equivalent of stable/Juno.

This improves release-to-release compatibility because clients can
now expect the same behavior from the Juno and Kilo APIs, when not
specifying any version header.

It does, however, present a break in backwards compatibility with
respect to MaintenanceController, which was made available by default
during Kilo prior to the addition of microversions, and is being removed
from the unversioned API now so as to maintain consistency in the API
changes during the Kilo cycle.

Related to blueprint api-microversions

Change-Id: I3da0fa52c6e8937c0893464887d9f7e014123224

commit_message:
Support the equivalent of the Juno API

Shortly after Kilo development was opened, the new MaintenanceController
class and REST endpoint, along with the 'maintenance_reason' property
were added. This was done before microversion support was added to the
Kilo API.

When we later added microversion support, the initial (and minimum
supported) version was declared to be v1.1, with the intent that v1.0
would be equivalent to Juno. However the work was not done at that time
to actually implement it as such, and for the intervening time, Ironic's
REST API has defaulted to v1.1

This patch goes back and adds a guard around the maintenance API
changes, such that it is possible for the API service to provide
the same API semantics that Juno supported.

It lowers the API MIN_VERSION from 1.1 to 1.0, thus changing the default
behavior of Ironic's REST API (in the absence of any version header)
to be the equivalent of stable/Juno.

This improves release-to-release compatibility because clients can
now expect the same behavior from the Juno and Kilo APIs, when not
specifying any version header.

It does, however, present a break in backwards compatibility with
respect to MaintenanceController, which was made available by default
during Kilo prior to the addition of microversions, and is being removed
from the unversioned API now so as to maintain consistency in the API
changes during the Kilo cycle.

Related to blueprint api-microversions

Change-Id: I3da0fa52c6e8937c0893464887d9f7e014123224

commit_message:
Add file logging for rsync xinetd service

Because rsyslog does not run inside rsync container,
its log messages are lost.

Added log rotation for new rsync.log file.

Change-Id: Ie67018966315642526fa9a112590a559632d0118
Closes-bug: #1414604

commit_message:
Try to calculate common CPU feature set

For multinode testing to test live migration we need to run VMs with a
common set of CPU feature flags. To make this more difficult each
environment we run in may present heterogenous CPU flags. Work around
this by dynamically determining the feature set for each test env then
apply this via a custom cpu model called 'gate64'.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>
Change-Id: I3df2fd53bfde04b32c3fd69ba46a1f591a9b1788

commit_message:
FIX: disable_offload from interface_properties isn't applied to bonded physical interfaces

This fix contains two sub-fixes:
* old code contains wrong logical condition. 
  In some cases was called .empty? method for non-hash or nil objects
* while parsing transformations for bonds, 'disable-offloading' flag 
  should be passed to bond-members transparently.

Closes-bug: #1433462
Change-Id: I63920e964a2ef4d3eb26c7a6175d2a676b426de0

subject: Rebase on pypowervm making xag default to None
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-04 03:55:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Rebase on pypowervm making xag default to None

pypowervm change set Ia6e9b0644745dcc3ef60b4a10fcb6141a766bbe7 makes
extended attribute group 'None' the default when an adapter read or
update is performed without xag specified.

This work effort was to ensure that all cases of read and update either
specify the correct xag(s) or really don't need any of them.  Only one
potential perpetrator was found:

nova_powervm.virt.powervm.vios.py used a xag-less VIOS read in
get_vios_wrap.  Turns out this method's only consumer,
add_vscsi_mapping, is no longer used (add_vscsi_mapping logic was moved
to pypowervm).  So I eliminated both methods and their vestiges.

Change-Id: Ia6f59365e8db0cb7c54ef3aaad68b5e96001da67

commit_message:
Rebase on pypowervm making xag default to None

pypowervm change set Ia6e9b0644745dcc3ef60b4a10fcb6141a766bbe7 makes
extended attribute group 'None' the default when an adapter read or
update is performed without xag specified.

This work effort was to ensure that all cases of read and update either
specify the correct xag(s) or really don't need any of them.  Only one
potential perpetrator was found:

nova_powervm.virt.powervm.vios.py used a xag-less VIOS read in
get_vios_wrap.  Turns out this method's only consumer,
add_vscsi_mapping, is no longer used (add_vscsi_mapping logic was moved
to pypowervm).  So I eliminated both methods and their vestiges.

Also eliminated the following unused pieces in that same module:
AbstractVIOSException
VIOSNotFound
get_vios_uuid
get_vscsi_mappings

Change-Id: Ia6f59365e8db0cb7c54ef3aaad68b5e96001da67

commit_message:
Implement LPAR.search in vm.UUIDCache

Convert a case of explicit search via pypowervm.adapter.Adapter.read to
use pypowervm.wrappers.logical_partition.LPAR.search instead.  This also
led to refactoring some of the associated code to use the LPAR
EntryWrapper instead of raw responses.

Change-Id: Ib9de694e629a771eb8bec066eecaa8415d8f1f6d

[{'created': '2015-03-20 19:22:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Allow cinderclient to handle exception response

For all cinder commands, the error message returned by the cinder
service is gobbled by keystoneclient as raise_exc is enabled by
default and it doesn't have the knowledge of how to interpret
exception returned by the cinder service correctly.

Set raise_exc to False explicitly in request method of cinderclient
and pass it to the keystoneclient session request method so that
keystoneclient raises exception only when the exception is raised
by the keystone server else cinderclient should interpret the
exception returned by the cinder service.

commit_message:
Allow cinderclient to handle exception response

For all cinder commands, the error message returned by the cinder
service is gobbled by keystoneclient as raise_exc is enabled by
default and it doesn't have the knowledge of how to interpret
exception returned by the cinder service correctly.

Set raise_exc to False explicitly in request method of cinderclient
and pass it to the keystoneclient session request method so that
keystoneclient raises exception only when the exception is raised
by the keystone server else cinderclient should interpret the
exception returned by the cinder service.

Closes-Bug: 1431693
Closes-Bug: 1428764
Change-Id: I1160a2c998919b669c39a4b739e83f5bd9d8d235

commit_message:
Adding transclude to search-bar for batch actions

Currently, there is no good way to align the batch/table actions along with
the search bar. The best way is to treat each element in the row as a
table-cell. To achieve this, we transclude the search bar so that it is possible
to embed additional actions.

Co-Authored-By: Kelly Domico <kelly.domico@hp.com>
Closes-bug: #1436107
Change-Id: I47905601e4ddf687d6554ff67eabaa3e6985f202

commit_message:
Fix functional test_signal_during_suspend

With some particular timing the stack returned by stack.get() is still
in SUSPEND_IN_PROGRESS and lacks `outputs` attribute.

Wait not only for nested stack to go to SUSPEND_COMPLETE, but for parent
stack too.

Change-Id: I8248146089f517c89f19321b796bfe750b14983b
Closes-Bug: #1440653

commit_message:
Update qemu package name for Ubuntu aarch64

The qemu-system package, and not qemu-kvm, should be installed on either
trusty- or utopic-based ARMv8 (aarch64) Ubuntu releases. Additionally,
libguestfs is not available so that is not installed.

No changes are required for vivid.

Change-Id: Id9dc1fc465bd7acab17c991c292fb531016758ad
Signed-off-by: Andrew McDermott <andrew.mcdermott@linaro.org>

commit_message:
Remove trove

There is currently no grenade testing of Trove, and we are working
to move trove devstack support into a plugin.  Remove the few
references to trove in this repo.

Change-Id: I7671a657be48cf9ae0211a51e4bc08867a231c73

commit_message:
Automatic cleanup of share_servers

Share servers should automatically be deleted after some time if there
are no associated shares.

Deletion is controlled by a period event in the share manager, it is run
every 10 minutes.

Add config option 'automatic_share_server_cleanup' (boolean). If it is set
to True, automatic cleanup of share servers would be enabled.

Add config option 'unused_share_server_cleanup_interval' which indicates
how long time unused share server would exists before it will be deleted.
This value should be between 10 and 60 minutes.

Add 'verify_free_share_servers_deletion_interval' function to validate this
parameter.

Add DB API function 'share_server_get_all_unused_deletable' to get all share servers
which was unused from given moment. This function is run every 10 minutes.

Implements bp automatic-cleanup-of-share-servers

Change-Id: Id78556b34c7ea1e48b6a5b5850400ca5c08d8543

commit_message:
Enable developers to see pylint output

The program tools/lintstack.py which is executed by
tools/lintstack.sh when Jenkins runs, only tests for differences
in the output of pylint. Right now, there seems to be
17 errors/warnings that are being carried over from fix to fix,
with no difference between fixes, and so no failures in the
pylint Jenkins job.

It is really difficult to tell what the errors are, so this fix
allows developers determine what the errors are by running the
following command:

$ tox -e lint

A sample output of the command is available as an attachment
to the bug.

Change-Id: I88487829576d55d437b934e08571013b7a6e57cf
Signed-off-by: Luis Pab√≥n <lpabon@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1356588
Signed-off-by: Luis Pab√≥n <lpabon@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add initial functional tests for simple cert order

Add the first functional test for generating a simple certificate
order, which is the first of the extended-workflow order types that
utilize the retry processing logic. Also add information to the
developer documentation.

Change-Id: I96f42b58530b841dcfc382e64642034ee3b65d12

commit_message:
Remove mkdir of shared dir

We no longer bindmount qemu directories and instead use the
volume_from feature to get that job done.  As such remove the
creation of the directory.

Change-Id: I20aa0b5d8b8e5e0bd9ccc69ab07009635c693b02

development tool.  Instead suggest an alternative.

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-04-02 20:23:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Check for SELinux in enforcing mode and exit if found

choice by the administrator, not something that should be done in a

manually.

', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-04-02 22:17:41.000000000', 'files': ['tools/start'], 'message': 'Check for SELinux in enforcing mode and exit if found

commit_message:
Check for SELinux in enforcing mode and exit if found

Previously the start script would disable SELinux  That is a policy
choice by the administrator, not something that should be done in a
development tool.  Instead suggest setting SELinux to permissive mode
manually.

Change-Id: I342a1614f9c10ec066cd2a8dc79280481e0b7570

commit_message:
[Docs] Remove subsection numberings in the Rally tutorial

The subsection (not chapter) numberings in Rally step-to-step manual make
little sense, since these sections are mostly indendent. So let's remove them.

commit_message:
Limit version of python-memcached

A change incompatible with keystone's `memcache_pool` cache backend
was introduced in `python-memcached` release 1.54. Limiting the version
is the safiest option now.

Change-Id: I7845521378741cce8706c85fb6bf00c6eb0ced59
Related-Bug: 1440493

commit_message:
Add functionality for installing Fuel from USB instead of cdrom

Installing Fuel from USB drive.
To enable just export ADMIN_BOOT_DEVICE=usb
This patch has depends in fuel-devops,
so please merge after https://review.openstack.org/#/c/169018/

Change-Id: I1747a496ef83abb8f23544a04fa37f239c4013e3
Closes-Bug: #1425941

The datapath object was not updated when a switch reconnected to the SDN controller
When receiving the switch features always update the data path object

commit_message:
Rebase on pypowervm XAGEnum and entities refactor

Accomodate change set I4df3110867273114a69a46d079e09131d62e2046 in
pypowervm whereby pypowervm.wrappers.virtual_io_server.XAGEnum is moved
to pypowervm.wrappers.virtual_io_server.VIOS.xags and the VIOS_ prefix
is removed from the enum keys.

Accomodate change set I8167d0aae181cdfb31db10becb58f8bfb9ba5568 in
pypowervm whereby Feed, Entry, Element, and XAGEnum were moved from
pypowervm.adapter to the new module pypowervm.entities.

Change-Id: I5eafe44efc3d92c9f7ed018e98721f8bc878b643

Re-thinking Fuel Client

This spec describes some ideas for making Fuel client
better for developers, deployers and end-users.

commit_message:
Allow overwriting some Manila tempest settings in CI jobs

This patch allows the following Manila tempest options to be set,
rather than hardcoded, in Jenkins CI jobs:

- suppress_errors_in_cleanup
- run_manage_unmanage_tests
- multitenancy_enabled

Change-Id: If566501cd5c97be37c6e018080e604fd76b6605d

[{'created': '2015-03-24 15:15:16.000000000', 'files': ['saharaclient/tests/functional/test_readonly_sahara.py', 'saharaclient/tests/functional/__init__.py', 'saharaclient/tests/functional/base.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Copy functional tests from tempest CLI

The tests have been copied almost as they are from tempest repository,
location: tempest/cli/simple_read_only/data_processing/
master commit: 6e8e5e1f882ec339fe3838e3e52345d2e1c5f5a1.

Changes made:
 - remove dependency to global CONFIG object; test_sahara_plugins_show
   now dynamically gets the list of available plugins instead of relying
   on the configuration;
 - remove test.attr and test.idempotent_id decorators, not available
   in tempest-lib (for now?)

ceilometerclient commits.
This is part of the effort of moving CLI tests to project repositories.

Change-Id: I652183238ff3d96bf6c9945aef902fd04cdff362
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Copy functional tests from tempest CLI

The tests have been copied almost as they are from tempest repository,
location: tempest/cli/simple_read_only/data_processing/
master commit: 6e8e5e1f882ec339fe3838e3e52345d2e1c5f5a1.

Changes made:
 - remove dependency to global CONFIG object; test_sahara_plugins_show
   now dynamically gets the list of available plugins instead of relying
   on the configuration;
 - remove test.attr and test.idempotent_id decorators, not available
   in tempest-lib (for now?)

Changes heavily adapted from the corresponding novaclient and
ceilometerclient commits.
This is part of the effort of moving CLI tests to project repositories.

Change-Id: I652183238ff3d96bf6c9945aef902fd04cdff362

subject: Avoid reloading policy files in policy.d for every call
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-06 14:44:51.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_policy/policy.py', 'oslo_policy/tests/test_policy.py'], 'message': 'Avoid reloading policy files in policy.d for every call

We added policy files in policy.d, currently, the code will
reload the policy in policy.d every enforce been called.

This patch caches the file mtime of the most newest file in
the directory (or the directory itself if it is empty) and uses
that to detect if we need to reload files in the policy.d
directory.

Change-Id: I3ab1ce1f2132ea8672bf0765ee4b30ad126d4559
Closes-Bug: 1437992
Co-Authored-By: Eli Qiao <liyong.qiao@intel.com>
Cherry-pick: Ia8c273c8566a4b472cb8807b1576ef1dee8ef054
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Avoid reloading policy files in policy.d for every call

We added policy files in policy.d, currently, the code will
reload the policy in policy.d every enforce been called.

This patch caches the file mtime of the most newest file in
the directory (or the directory itself if it is empty) and uses
that to detect if we need to reload files in the policy.d
directory.

Change-Id: I3ab1ce1f2132ea8672bf0765ee4b30ad126d4559
Closes-Bug: 1437992
Co-Authored-By: Eli Qiao <liyong.qiao@intel.com>
Cherry-pick: Ia8c273c8566a4b472cb8807b1576ef1dee8ef054

commit_message:
Create tests for controller maintenance mode

Add first test for feature, which deploys cluster
and switch in maintenance mode on each controller.
The second test which deploys the cluster and
automatically goes into the maintenance mode
when unexpected reboot.

Implements: blueprint controller-maintenance-mode-tests

Change-Id: Ib94c584ff8de06dfa8f9d3fb7b4477a362b9a433

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-31 08:57:20.000000000', 'files': ['elements/tripleo-cd/bin/prepare-ci-overcloud'], 'message': 'Check USE_CACHE for fedora and ubuntu images.

check if use cache for fedora and precise images and query for
fedora image name only if USE_CACHE is false so internet access
is not necessary.
also fixed a bug in setting NP_CREDS, openstack-nodepool usename
and password should be used for its tenant.

Change-Id: I2d9f662b7764a95a7de3e62592f3a8bcb24b3a52
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Check USE_CACHE for fedora and ubuntu images.

check if use cache for fedora and precise images and query for
fedora image name only if USE_CACHE is false so internet access
is not necessary.
also fixed a bug in setting NP_CREDS, openstack-nodepool usename
and password should be used for its tenant.

Change-Id: I2d9f662b7764a95a7de3e62592f3a8bcb24b3a52

commit_message:
Use UTC to compute heartbeat age in eject-replica-source

Use datetime.utcnow() rather than datetime.now() when
computing the age of guest-agent heartbeats.

Change-Id: Ia884db023e5b2cd076b3f9edb694caf428c8ca81
Closes-bug: #1439844

commit_message:
Reliable CSV reports generation implemented

We should generate CSV reports in case of errors in the flatten
data processing. Invalid data is skipped.

Change-Id: I22ea7cb4f22024329f3bf55fd855e04b8f4f285d
Closes-Bug: #1440080

commit_message:
Check volume status in detach db api

If a volume is detached while uploading volume to image is in progress then
it sets volume status to available and then it is allowed to delete it
immediately while uploading is still running in background.

Set the status to available in the detach db api only when the volume
is not migrating and status is not uploading.

Closes-Bug: 1413887
Change-Id: I6df9c6918825fba7c8d7cd6521752b399dd61610

commit_message:
Prepare for unit test reorg

The unit test reorg is about moving files around so a test module is
clearly associated with the code module it targets, but the test
modules in this change needed to be manually merged because they both
targeted the same module.

test_api_v2 is also updated to use the path of neutron/tests/base.py
as the root of path to test implementations of extensions.

Change-Id: I432b84339e51c26ef0aa26d44e29b5a3311626ad
Implements: bp/reorganize-unit-test-tree

commit_message:
WIP: Avoid expensive loop when NBD module is absent

When looking at a rally profile (see bug), ended up finding
this loop in nova.virt.disk.mount.api.Mount's
_get_dev_retry_helper method. Specifically for Nbd, when
nbd is entriely absent, we still end up looping and retrying.

Closes-Bug: #1438260
Change-Id: I5245a5a9c3d35ccf73b0eaf28a2c93a4c6ec8fdf

subject: Fixing selenium tests to work with Django 1.7
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-03 23:07:16.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/test/helpers.py'], 'message': 'Fixing selenium tests to work with Django 1.7

Django changed the functionality of django.test.LiveServerTestCase
in 1.7  The old functionality is now supported by
django.contrib.testing.StaticLiveServerTestCase

This adds a version check to do a conditional import to pull in
either the old test case class or the new.

For more information see:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.7/ref/contrib/staticfiles/#specialized-test-case-to-support-live-testing

Closes-Bug: #1439169
Change-Id: I182847a8e77de0b9c279eeb305b536d8cdf6c43b
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixing selenium tests to work with Django 1.7

Django changed the functionality of django.test.LiveServerTestCase
in 1.7  The old functionality is now supported by
django.contrib.testing.StaticLiveServerTestCase

This adds a version check to do a conditional import to pull in
either the old test case class or the new.

For more information see:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.7/ref/contrib/staticfiles/#specialized-test-case-to-support-live-testing

Closes-Bug: #1439169
Change-Id: I182847a8e77de0b9c279eeb305b536d8cdf6c43b

subject: Specify versions for VMware env
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-24 10:30:22.000000000', 'files': ['pages/planning-guide/7000-nsx-plan.rst', 'pages/planning-guide/7000-vcenter-plan.rst'], 'message': "Specify versions for VMware env

    The following VMware NSX, vCenter and ESXi version were tested:

    - vCenter 5.5
    - NSX 4.0.1 (Gateway, Manager, Controller, Service node)
    - NSX OVS 2.0 (it's not a vanilla OVS, it's NSX OVS = NSX bits)

    The following lab setup is used:

    - MOS 6.0 on Centos 6.5 - was tested and working
    - MOS 6.0 on Ubuntu 12.04 - was tested and not working
    ,because of the incompatibility of Linux version
     (it's 3.13) and NSX OVS version (2.0)

Change-Id: Ibf7e1cd555002925f4d9ecd2b60f01bc61707577
Closes-Bug: 1403122
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Specify versions for VMware env

    The following VMware NSX, vCenter and ESXi version were tested:

    - vCenter 5.5
    - NSX 4.0.1 (Gateway, Manager, Controller, Service node)
    - NSX OVS 2.0 (it's not a vanilla OVS, it's NSX OVS = NSX bits)

    The following lab setup is used:

    - MOS 6.0 on Centos 6.5 - was tested and working
    - MOS 6.0 on Ubuntu 12.04 - was tested and not working
    ,because of the incompatibility of Linux version
     (it's 3.13) and NSX OVS version (2.0)

Change-Id: Ibf7e1cd555002925f4d9ecd2b60f01bc61707577
Closes-Bug: 1403122

commit_message:
Update lxc-docker to 1.5.0 for iso build

lxc-docker-1.3.2 has upstream issue
https://github.com/docker/docker/issues/8714
which causes failures in allocating ports
dynamically. Updating resolves this.

Change-Id: I7fd22591a330ecb4ab0741af9f58fdd4dee54b18
Closes-Bug: #1440663

commit_message:
[Sahara] Add support for anti-affinity

The anti-affinity feature allows to schedule one vm per compute in the
cluster. This feature is ment to provide the best reliability for HDFS
service of Hadoop. Also it can be used to "warmup" sahara images which
means the images are going to be cached on the compute node after the
firs launch. All the next benchmarks sohuld run faster with such image.

Change-Id: Ib39b4cff5d8ec525d2af143d5bc22185ff7339ca

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8749, 'name': 'Evgeniy L', 'email': 'eli@mirantis.com', 'username': 'evgeniyl'}, {'_account_id': 8782, 'name': 'Anastasia Palkina', 'email': 'apalkina@mirantis.com'}, {'_account_id': 8789, 'name': 'Dmitry Pyzhov', 'email': 'dpyzhov+gerrit@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dpyzhov'}, {'_account_id': 8907, 'name': 'Dmitry Shulyak', 'email': 'dshulyak@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dshulyak'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9037, 'name': 'Dmitry Ilyin', 'email': 'idv1985@gmail.com', 'username': 'dilyin'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-31 17:03:57.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/nailgun_hooks.rb', 'spec/unit/nailgun_hooks_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Global shell timeout

Plugin developer can set timeout for operation, but this timeout is working differently for different operation:

Before:

* shell -> timeout*retries (Mcollective retries, 2 by default)
* puppet -> global timeout

Now:

* shell -> global timeout
* puppet -> global timeout

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ie9e33732630097ce5e0ccc7128b6f9514e30176d
Closes-Bug: #1438725
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Global shell timeout

Plugin developer can set timeout for operation, but this timeout is working differently for different operation:

Before:

* shell -> timeout*retries (Mcollective retries, 2 by default)
* puppet -> global timeout

Now:

* shell -> global timeout
* puppet -> global timeout

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ie9e33732630097ce5e0ccc7128b6f9514e30176d
Closes-Bug: #1438725

commit_message:
remove v3 api from paste configuration

v3 is no more, we should clean up this externalized reference which
also lets us drop the v3 specific noauth middleware (not used anywhere
else)

Change-Id: I967713213cb7a4a9ab9e7ad1e47d09936daabcad
Closes-Bug: #1428136

commit_message:
remove API v3 test mixins for functional client

API v3 is no more, and we should remove remnants of testing in our
tree for it for clarity. This removes the test mixins that were used
by the API samples.

Change-Id: I4e3aeecc099050ffecb11e9e35206c268dac0d33

commit_message:
remove API v3 samples tests

API v3 is no more, and the last internal test remnants of the v3
surface should be purged before release.

Change-Id: I192687ecceff0092298b215692270a0b9a9040f1

commit_message:
Added provider_id to volume and snapshot object

This feature helps cinder drivers to access provider
information without resorting to DB access in their driver code.

Closes-Bug: #1430145
Change-Id: I72bcbdafd1c2ec24fa4c52978c88b8518db2a1ec

commit_message:
Fix name editing during modify step of package upload

Due to clash of field names in forms in form-wizard
name field got overriden and was removed during last step
Fixes the bug and introduces a corresponding test-case

Change-Id: I8518bcd1fccbd5d7c94cb5aee262da93f9a31c6a
Closes-Bug: #1439765

subject: Pass username/password to client
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-05 08:28:25.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_osclients.py', 'rally/osclients.py'], 'message': 'Pass username/password to client

Currently when python clients are called, Rally authenticates
with keystone client then pass then token to the clients.
This behavior will break the test when the token gets expired.

When the token gets expired, the operations using the token
will receive a 401 error which instructs the clients to
re-new the token with the user crendentials. The python clients
will re-authenticate and try to re-send the operation request.

However, since the credentials are not passed by Rally,
the clients are unable to re-authenticate in which case
the operation will fail and break the test.

This patch is going to pass the credentials to the python clients
to allow the test go beyond the token expiration time.

This patch mainly focus on nova and neutron.
Please note that some clients do not support this
re-authentication mechanism.

Change-Id: I2732e9c7053005b265df3122181f99544d4b6100
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Pass username/password to client

Currently when python clients are called, Rally authenticates
with keystone client then pass then token to the clients.
This behavior will break the test when the token gets expired.

When the token gets expired, the operations using the token
will receive a 401 error which instructs the clients to
re-new the token with the user crendentials. The python clients
will re-authenticate and try to re-send the operation request.

However, since the credentials are not passed by Rally,
the clients are unable to re-authenticate in which case
the operation will fail and break the test.

This patch is going to pass the credentials to the python clients
to allow the test go beyond the token expiration time.

This patch mainly focus on nova and neutron.
Please note that some clients do not support this
re-authentication mechanism.

Change-Id: I2732e9c7053005b265df3122181f99544d4b6100
